item.value: The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
In 1783 Jean Pilatre de Rozier ( a Frenchman ) made the first balloon flight, reaching a peak altitude of about 500 ft, and traveling about 51/2 mi in 20 min.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
Tides are caused by the rotation of the Earth and the gravitational effects of the Moon and Sun.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters.
The lowest temperature ever recorded world was at Vostok Station, Antarctica on the 21 July 1983. it was a bitter -89.6C
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
China has the largest population of any country. It has over 1.3 billion people.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system. Jupiter is the largest planet.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
There are more than 2,700 languages ( + more than 7,000 dialects) in the world. More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
Sneezing with your eyes open is impossible
The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall. The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. Cheetahs can run much faster than people.
The Sun is one of about 200 billion stars in the Milky Way galaxy. The most current estimates guess that there are 100 to 200 billion galaxies in the Universe
